title: Cinnamon Sugar Donut Muffins  (makes 12)
abstract:
I’ve been very lax about my turn with the cooks’ column segment, but here I am back on deck finally… I can just imagine Glen’s sigh of relief!
I do love a good cinnamon donut with a cuppa, and Mum isn’t one to EVER refuse a sweet thing with a cuppa either (as proven this morning in her eagerness to taste test the final product immediately after finishing her bowl of cereal!).  I hope you give these a try.  They are so simple to make, but so satisfyingly delicious too.  Happy Baking.
method: Grease muffin tins or line with cupcake papers.
Put flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and spices in a  large bowl and stir together until combined. Set aside.
In a small bowl beat the egg. Add the milk., vanilla extract, and cooled melted butter and mix well to combine.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and mix with wooden spoon until JUST combined. Be careful not to over mix.
Spoon batter into muffin cases about ½ - ¾ full. Bake in preheated oven for 20-25 mins, or until they are lightly browned and spring back to the touch.
Cool for 5 minutes in the pan before removing them.
In a small bowl mix together the cinnamon and the sugar.  In another small bowl melt the butter.
Dip the muffins in the melted butter, then roll in the cinnamon sugar mixture.
